author: undetermined
full_text:
Here's the extracted content from the HTML:

ICSE, ISC Result 2023 Live: CISCE Class 10th, 12th results out, toppers list here

By HT Education Desk, New Delhi
May 14, 2023 8:22 PM IST

Key Highlights:
- CISCE has announced ICSE and ISC results for 2023
- Results available on cisce.org and result.cisce.org
- Students can check results using unique ID and index number

Exam Details:
- ICSE final exams held from February 27 to March 29, 2023
- ISC final exams held from February 13 to March 31, 2023
- Around 2.5 lakh candidates appeared for CISCE year 2023 board exams

Result Statistics:
- Total ICSE candidates: 237,631
  - Boys: 128,131 (53.92%)
  - Girls: 109,500 (46.08%)

- Total ISC candidates: 98,505
  - Boys: 51,781 (52.57%)
  - Girls: 46,724 (47.43%)

Pass Percentage:
- ICSE: 98.94%
- ISC: 96.93%

ICSE Class 10 Toppers:
1. Rushil Kumar
2. Annanya Karthik
3. Shreya Upadhyay
4. Advay Sardesai
5. Yash Manish Bhasein
6. Tanay Sushil Shah
7. Hiya Sanghavi
8. Avishi Singh
9. Sambit Mukhopadhyay

ISC Class 12 Toppers:
1. Riyaa Agarwal
2. Ipshita Bhattacharyya
3. Mohd Aryaan Tariq
4. Subham Kumar Agarwal
5. Manya Gupta

Re-checking Process:
- Students can apply for re-checking till May 21
- ICSE: ₹1,000 per paper
- ISC: ₹1,000 per subject

How to Check Results:
1. Go to cisce.org or results.cisce.org
2. Select ICSE or ISC results
3. Enter course code, candidate UID, index number, and captcha
4. Click "Show Result" button
5. Print result if needed
title: Fact:  The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) will today announce the result of Indian Certificate of Secondary Education (ICSE) and Indian School Certificate (ISC) result 2023. The result for both classes will be released at 3 pm. Students can check it on cisce.org and results.cisce.org using unique ID and index number.
vclaim: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) has announced the 2023 ICSE (Class 10) and ISC (Class 12) examination results. The ICSE examination achieved a pass percentage of 98.94%, while the ISC examination recorded a pass percentage of 96.93%. A total of 237,631 candidates appeared for ICSE and 98,505 candidates appeared for ISC examinations in 2023. Nine students topped the ICSE Class 10 examinations, with Rushil Kumar leading the list. Five students topped the ISC Class 12 examinations, with Riyaa Agarwal securing the top position. Students can apply for re-checking of their examination papers until May 21 by paying ₹1,000 per paper.
